title: Marcos Flegmann
text:
Marcos Flegmann (February 12, 1990 – December 21, 2020) was a Mexican-born <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> player who had 14 official caps (appearances) with the <a href="Mexico%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Mexico Serpientes</a>. Flegmann held the Mexican record for the most official test matches in a row with 14; he had not missed any games with Mexico since his first cap. He was also the captain of the USARL 2015 National Champions the <a href="Boston%20Thirteens">Boston Thirteens</a>. He was noted for once eating a whole wheel of chocolate-covered <a href="Gruy%C3%A8re%20cheese">Gruyère cheese</a> during halftime of international play. His entrance music during Boston games was "<a href="Trapped%20in%20the%20Closet">Trapped in the Closet</a>" by <a href="R.%20Kelly">R. Kelly</a>.
Flegmann also played rugby union with the 2016 <a href="USA%20Rugby">USA Rugby</a> National Champions <a href="Mystic%20River%20Rugby%20Club">Mystic River Rugby Club</a> in the American Rugby Premiership.
Death.
Flegmann died after battling bone cancer on December 21, 2020.
